item.title: 5 emergency 911 hotline telecommunicators infected with COVID-19, DILG spox says
item.description: At least five telecommunicators of Emergency 911 Hotline have been infected with COVID-19, Department of the Interior and Local Government (DILG) spokesperson Undersecretary Jonathan Malaya said on Monday.

item.title: Hontiveros wants probe on procurement of locally-made PPEs
item.description: "Our COVID-19 response budget can afford to supply more frontliners with more medical-grade equipment if we procure locally. We have the supply, we have the quality, and we have the funds -- bakit patuloy pa ang mass importation natin?" Senator Risa Hontiveros said in a statement.

item.title: Observe health and safety protocols, Comelec reminds new voter registrants
item.description: The Commission on Elections (Comelec) on Monday reminded the public to observe health and safety protocols during voter registration, which will resume on Tuesday, September 1, 2020.

item.title: LSIs camp outside Libingan ng mga Bayani
item.description: At least 50 locally stranded individuals are staying in makeshift tents outside Libingan ng mga Bayani in Taguig City hoping to avail government s assistance to return to their respective provinces, GMA s Unang Balita reported Monday.

item.title: Withdrawal of designated survivor bill in House unfortunate, says Lacson
item.description: Senator Panfilo Lacson said the bill in the upper chamber, prescribing a designated successor in case the top four leaders of the Philippine government perish, must be discussed as soon as possible to avoid a constitutional crisis.

item.title: 22-anyos na babae, patay sa pamamaril sa Kalibo; sketch ng suspek, inilabas
item.description: Isang 22-anyos na babae ang pinagbabaril hangang sa mapatay ng mga suspek na riding in tandem sa motorsiklo noong Biyernes ng gabi.

item.title: Duterte lauds Filipino frontliners on National Heroes' Day
item.description: On National Heroes' Day, President Rodrigo Duterte honored present-day heroes especially the medical frontliners who have been fighting to prevent the spread of COVID-19 in the country and even abroad.

item.title: 70-anyos na lalaki sa Bohol, patay matapos pagbabarilin ng lasing umanong sundalo
item.description: Patay ang isang lolo sa Bien Unido, Bohol matapos umanong pagbabarilin ng isang lasing na sundalo, ayon sa ulat ng Unang Balita nitong Lunes.

item.title: VP Robredo pays tribute to heroic frontliners amid COVID-19 pandemic
item.description: Vice President Leni Robredo on Monday paid tribute to frontline workers for their courage amid the COVID-19 pandemic on National Heroes Day.

item.title: Duterte to rebels: If we cannot really agree, then we fight hard hanggang magkaubusan na
item.description: President Rodrigo Duterte warned that if rebel groups cannot settle for peace with the government, state forces would intensify their efforts until all the troops and fighters die.

item.title: 4 treasure hunters buried as tunnel collapses in Davao del Norte
item.description: Four treasure hunters were buried when a tunnel collapsed in Santo Tomas, Davao del Norte, according to an Unang Balita report on Monday.

item.title: Metro Manila mayors recommending GCQ for another 30 days -- Olivarez
item.description: "Doon po sa pulong, pinagkaisahan po ng lahat ng mayors na irerekomenda sa IATF na i-maintain po 'yung GCQ, 'yung ating general community quarantine starting September 1," Parañaque City Mayor and Metro Manila Council chairman Edwin Olivarez said.

item.title: Duterte kisses ground during visit to Jolo blast site
item.description: President Rodrigo Duterte on Sunday visited Jolo, Sulu to condole with the victims of twin explosions that claimed at least 15 lives and wounded 75 others last week.

item.title: Jobless man nabbed in Taguig for allegedly stealing pork kasim
item.description: A man was nabbed for allegedly stealing pork in a mini grocery in Taguig City over the weekend.

item.title: Lorenzana calls on public to unite, support each other amid fight vs. COVID-19, criminality
item.description: As the country observes National Heroes' Day on Monday, Defense Secretary Delfin Lorenzana urged the public to unite and work together in the fight not only against the COVID-19 pandemic, but criminality and terrorism as well.
